title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Lion, from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Lion, from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image bordered in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on mount upper center:  Le Lion; on mount, lower center, over an erased graphite inscription [some words barely readable] :  a bas les pattes tu ne paye, jamais rien [down with your paws, you never pay me anything; ...sens la pipe [     ]; in graphite, on mount, upper right corner:  7
description: Scene at a masquerade party in a bar.  A man dressed in a lion's costume, center forground, has his arms around a young woman dressed as Diana who he appears to be kissing.  She wears a crescent crown and holds a bow.  She tells him to "take his paws off of her." She has her right foot planted on a platform upon which is a table with two wine bottles and a stool, left middleground.  Behind an arched opening, right background, there are two costumed figures who appear to be dancing.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Lion, from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image bordered in pen and brown ink. 
1989-13-41
